23eed5e4-71ed-47c7-a200-5be5ea6535d4.heading: GDP
23eed5e4-71ed-47c7-a200-5be5ea6535d4.audio: [MOCK AUDIO: 'So as I was saying, GDP stands for General Data Protection']
23eed5e4-71ed-47c7-a200-5be5ea6535d4.ocr: [MOCK OCR: 'Slide 4: GDP Growth, the GDP is the Gross Domestic Product (GDP)']
23eed5e4-71ed-47c7-a200-5be5ea6535d4.additional_notes: Important context from user: regarding 'There is a conflict regarding the meaning of GDP. The audio states that GDP stands for General Data Protection, while the OCR and notes refer to GDP as Gross Domestic Product, an economic indicator. Which definition should be used for this context?', the answer is 'It's Gross Domestic product'.
23eed5e4-71ed-47c7-a200-5be5ea6535d4.notes:
GDP stands for Gross Domestic Product. It is the primary economic indicator used to assess the wellness and economic health of a population. GDP measures the total value of goods and services produced within a country's borders over a specific period.

GDP stands for Gross Domestic Product. It is a key economic indicator that measures the total value of all goods and services produced within a country's borders over a specific period of time. Although there was a misstatement in the audio transcription, where GDP was referred to as "General Data Protection," the correct definition in the context of economics—and as confirmed by both the slide text and student notes—is Gross Domestic Product. GDP is widely used as a primary metric for assessing a country's economic growth and overall economic health, providing valuable insights into the performance and development of national economies.

e2312b04-723c-4f63-af6a-01a4bf674f6c.heading: Introduction and Definitions
e2312b04-723c-4f63-af6a-01a4bf674f6c.ocr: [PDF PAGE CONTENT]: Deep Neural Network s From Fully-Connected Nets to Compression Pietro Michiardi 15/02/2026, 11:49 Deep Learning – Deep Neural Networks https://eurecom-ds.github.io/deeplearning/editions/2026/slides/deep_nets.html?print-pdf#/title-slide 1/135  [PDF PAGE CONTENT]: Fully Connect ed Nets 15/02/2026, 11:49 Deep Learning – Deep Neural Networks https://eurecom-ds.github.io/deeplearning/editions/2026/slides/deep_nets.html?print-pdf#/title-slide 2/135  [PDF PAGE CONTENT]: Goal: estimate a function   from data; most ML problems can be cast this way. Simple motivating examples: Figure 1: Regression Figure 2: Classification We only observe samples   and minimize empirical risk to approximate  y = f ∗(x) Note xi, yi f ∗ Introduction and Definitions 15/02/2026, 11:49 Deep Learning – Deep Neural Networks https://eurecom-ds.github.io/deeplearning/editions/2026/slides/deep_nets.html?print-pdf#/title-slide 3/135
e2312b04-723c-4f63-af6a-01a4bf674f6c.notes: Deep Neural Networks (DNNs) are powerful models in machine learning whose primary goal is to estimate an unknown function from data. Most machine learning problems, including regression and classification, can be formulated as the task of learning a function \( f^* \) that maps input samples \( xi \) to outputs \( yi \). In practice, we only observe a finite set of sample pairs \((xi, yi)\), and the objective is to minimize the empirical risk, thereby reducing the approximation error between the predicted and true outputs. This foundational approach underpins the use of fully-connected neural networks and motivates the development of deeper architectures for improved function approximation.
